docs.title: 🚗 Autoware 3D SLAM & Navigation
docs.text: This section introduces the full workflow for RobiX/RobiS robots using the Autoware open-source autonomous driving framework with 3D LiDAR SLAM, waypoint recording, and cruise control.

docs.title: 1. Launch the Autoware Navigation Stack
docs.text: roslaunch ros_robot_control ros_robot_control.launch

docs.title: 2. Start the RViz-Based Navigation GUI
docs.text: rosrun robot_rviz_16 robot_rviz_16

docs.title: 3. Configure RViz Display Parameters
docs.text:
Use the following config file: 

~/catkin_ws/src/slam_app/ros_qt5_gui_app_rviz_16_en/default.yaml

docs.title: 4. Connect to Upper Computer
docs.text:
• Default main node: 127.0.0.1
  • Local IP: 127.0.0.1
  • Click Connect
  • If failed, restart the upper computer and try again

docs.title: 5. Start Point Cloud Recording
docs.text:
Click Start Pointclouds Record in the interface and drive the robot using the remote.

⚠️ Do not reverse or use erratic patterns like S-turns. Maintain a smooth and forward-only path.

Once done, stop recording.

docs.title: Option 1 — via RViz (not recommended):
docs.text: Use Publish Point to draw points manually.

docs.title: Option 2 — preferred:
docs.text: After finishing point cloud recording, click Start Trajectory Recording. The recorded path will reflect actual movement and is fully drivable.

docs.title: 7. Start Mapping + Trajectory Recording Together
docs.text:
1. Click Start Trajectory Recording
  2. Then click Start Mapping
  3. Wait until terminal output finishes (Duration stops updating)
  4. Stop recording — mapping completes automatically

docs.title: 8. Activate Navigation
docs.text:
1. Drive the robot to the initial point used during point cloud recording
  2. Click Start Navigation
  3. Switch to RViz tab
  4. Wait for map to load

If positioning seems off, use 2D Pose Estimate in RViz to manually align.

docs.title: 9. Enable Trajectory Cruise
docs.text:
1. Navigate to Status tab
  2. Click Enable Trajectory Cruise

Behavior: - Robot follows the path - Stops at the endpoint - If clicked again, will reverse the path

💡 If started at endpoint, the robot will go: end -> start -> end

If trajectory loop is enabled, the car will loop: 

start → end → U-turn → end → start → U-turn → ...

Ensure enough space for U-turns.

docs.title: 10. Start Waypoint Follower
docs.text:
⚠️ Robot will start immediately when this mode is activated.

  • Set the robot to remote control mode first
  • Ensure safety and environment clearance
  • Press emergency stop if needed

❗ Navigation and tracking modes cannot run at the same time. Turn off navigation first.

Use 2D Pose Estimate to initialize pose if needed.

docs.title: Obstacle Handling
docs.text:
• Robot stops for obstacles only in the red box detection zone
  • Obstacle must not be too close (<0.2m blind zone)
  • Robot resumes 2 seconds after the obstacle moves away

docs.title: 🤖 Introduction to RobiS and RobiX Robots
docs.text: Welcome to the RobiS and RobiX robot documentation. These robots are designed for research, education, and autonomous mobility scenarios with different configurations and onboard capabilities.

docs.title: 📋 RobiS Robot Specifications

ℹ️ Continue to the Remote Control Setup section to get started with operation.

docs.title: 🎮 Remote Control Setup for RobiX Robot
⚠️ Safety Notes
docs.text:
1. First-use check:
  2. After unboxing, raise the chassis so all wheels are off the ground.
  3. Power on, press the red e-stop and verify it cuts motor drive.
  4. Only lower the chassis when no abnormal noise or vibration is heard.
  5. Charging:
  6. Shut the chassis down, press the e-stop, and use only the supplied charger.
  7. Crowded / tight spaces:
  8. Select low-speed gear before moving.
  9. First stick movement after unlocking:
  10. Move the right stick LEFT / RIGHT only (differential turn) to confirm response.
  11. Only then push the stick forward / backward.

docs.title: 🕹️ Basic Operation
docs.text: Stick / Switch Function Description Left stick ↑ Forward Drive forward Left stick ↓ Backward Drive backward Right stick ← Turn left Differential left turn Right stick → Turn right Differential right turn SWB (up · middle · down) Control source Up: None (auto-charge on dock-capable units)  Middle: PC / autopilot  Down: Radio control SWA (up · down) Speed limit Up: Full speed  Down: Half speed SWC (any) — No function SWD (up · down) Emergency stop Up: Activate e-stop  Down: Release e-stop Power buttons TX power Long-press both to turn remote on / off VRA / VRB — No function

docs.title: 🔧 Bumper & Audible Alerts
docs.text:
• Bumper triggered → press & release red e-stop or toggle SWD ↑ then ↓ to resume.
  • Continuous beep after power-on idle → jog any stick or power-cycle; also check battery level.

Keep SWA–D in the down position for safe manual driving.

docs.title: 🖥️ Remote Login (NoMachine)
docs.text: Remotely access the RobiX robot using the built-in NoMachine server.

docs.title: ✅ Default Credentials
docs.text:
• Username: robify
  • Password: robify1234 (also used for sudo)

docs.title: 🔗 Standard Connection Steps
docs.text:
1. Install NoMachine on your computer: https://downloads.nomachine.com/

  2. Skip the corresponding operation steps according to the instructions, check them, and click OK in sequence.

  3. The navigation car is equipped with the corresponding NoMachine remote software (Arm8 architecture) at the factory. When the car is connected to the same LAN as the computer (mandatory), the SSH service of the current York car will be automatically displayed on the following interface. Double click to proceed.

  4. Next, if you reinstall the NoMachine server, confirm to regenerate the SSL certificate, and select OK. Not skipped.

  5. Login with: Username: robify Password: robify1234

  6. Then you will see some tutorial instructions for some tools, skip the corresponding operation steps according to the instructions, check them, click OK in sequence, and wait to enter the system.

docs.title: Issue: Multiple Robots Detected
docs.text:
1. Click Edit Connection

  2. Set correct IP manually. Port: 4000, Protocol: NX

  3. Use ifconfig on the robot to check IP address.

  4. After switching IP, connecting again will prompt for IP address change. Select [OK]

docs.title: Issue: Certificate Expired
docs.text:
Reinstall NoMachine on the robot:

sudo apt-get remove nomachine-enterprise-desktop
sudo dpkg -i nomachine_8.16.1_1_arm64.deb

Make sure the .deb file is in the correct directory.

🧠 Tip: If the touch screen is unresponsive on first login, press Enter before typing the password.

docs.title: 🚀 Launch Autoware core
docs.text: roslaunch ros_robot_control ros_robot_control.launch

docs.title: 🖥️ Start the upper-computer GUI
docs.text: rosrun robot_rviz_16 robot_rviz_16

docs.title: ⚙️ Load RViz preset
docs.text:
Select:

catkin_ws/src/slam_app/ros_qt5_gui_app_rviz_16_en/default.yaml

docs.title: 🔗 Connect (auto by default)
docs.text: Master IP: 127.0.0.1 Local IP: 127.0.0.1 Click Connect; if it fails, restart the GUI.

docs.title: 📹 Record point-clouds
docs.text: Press Pointclouds Record, then drive once around the desired area (no reversing / sharp S-curves). When finished, press Stop Record and remember the start pose.

docs.title: 📍 Record trajectory (Waypoint Saver)
docs.text: After point-cloud recording, press Waypoint Saver to store the drivable path.

docs.title: 🗺️ Build map & save waypoints
docs.text:
1. Start Waypoint Saver

  2. Press Mapping

  3. Wait until terminal output stops (Duration finished)

  4. Stop Waypoint Saver (mapping stops automatically)

docs.title: 🧭 Start Navigation
docs.text: Drive back to the original start pose. Press Navigation, switch to RViz tab and wait for the map. If localization drifts, set initial pose with 2D Pose Estimate and drive a short distance to trigger re-localization (color points ≈ white map). Send a goal with 2D Nav Goal; switch the remote to PC-mode and the chassis will navigate.

docs.title: 🔁 Cruise along recorded trajectory
docs.text:
Go back to the Status tab and click Start Cruise Trajectory; the robot will follow the recorded path, avoid obstacles on the way, and stop automatically at the end point. Press Start Cruise Trajectory again and it performs an in-place U-turn and drives back to the start. (Once Navigation is activated the trajectory index is reset; cruise always begins from the first waypoint. If the vehicle is physically at the end when you first press cruise, the sequence becomes: end → start → end, which is why you should drive it back to the start before enabling cruise.)

If the vehicle is not at the start or end when cruise is started, the algorithm finds the closest waypoint on the path and travels to the nearest terminal (start or end).

When Loop is checked before starting cruise, the robot enters an endless cycle: start → end → U-turn → end → start → U-turn … Make sure both ends provide sufficient space for U-turns; obstacle avoidance only protects the vehicle body—external accessories are not guaranteed safe.

docs.title: 🛤️ Waypoint Follower (Pure following)
docs.text:
⚠️ The robot moves immediately — set remote to RC mode first, confirm safety, then switch to PC/Nav mode (or arm e-stop). Navigation must be OFF; start from the original cloud-record pose or set it with 2D Pose Estimate. Obstacles → stop only (no avoidance); Cruise Trajectory is needed for detour. Stopping zone is the red rectangle; objects < 0.2 m or too low may be ignored. After the obstacle leaves, the vehicle auto-resumes in 2 s.

Please refer to the accompanying video.

docs.title: 🧭 Cartographer 2D Mapping and Navigation
docs.text: RobiS supports the Cartographer SLAM algorithm developed by Google. Cartographer offers higher mapping accuracy and integrated localization, but it requires more computational power.

docs.title: 🔧 Launch device driver
docs.text: roslaunch robot_start robot_start.launch

docs.title: 🗺️ Start Cartographer 2-D SLAM (new terminal)
docs.text:
roslaunch robot_start carto_2d_mapping.launch

Drive the robot in manual mode until the map covers the whole area.

docs.title: 💾 Save the map (new terminal)
docs.text:
sh catkin_ws/src/robot_start/sh/save_map.sh
When finished, stop the Cartographer node: Ctrl-C in its terminal.

docs.title: 🧭 Launch navigation
docs.text:
roslaunch robot_start teb_navigation_slam.launch
After setting the initial pose with 2D Pose Estimate, use 2D Nav Goal to click any spot for point-to-point navigation (switch the remote to PC-mode).

Please refer to the accompanying video.

docs.title: 🛠️ Initialization of chassis and sensor drivers
docs.text: Before using other functions of the RobiS robot, it's necessary to activate essential hardware modules such as the chassis drive, LiDAR, and IMU.

docs.title: 🚀 Bring up all chassis and sensor data
docs.text:
Open a new terminal and run:

roslaunch my_control run_device_only.launch

Verify the data stream:

rostopic echo /four_wheel_info

docs.title: 📷 Start the depth camera
docs.text:
New terminal:

roslaunch astra_camera astra_pro.launch

Visualise in RViz:

rviz
  • Click Add → By topic → pick the camera image topic.

  • In the image drop-down you can switch between depth, RGB or IR.

docs.title: 📡 Start the LiDAR
docs.text:
New terminal:

roslaunch vanjee_lidar_sdk start.launch

In RViz set the display Type to XYOrbit for a 3-D point-cloud view.

docs.title: 🧭 Start the IMU
docs.text:
New terminal:

roslaunch fdilink_ahrs ahrs_data.launch

Check the stream:

rostopic echo /robot_imu

docs.title: 🚗 Start the chassis node
docs.text:
New terminal:

roslaunch four_wheel four_wheel.launch

Send a motion command (example):

rostopic pub /cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist "linear:
  x: 0.2
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.0
angular:
  x: 0.0
  y: 0.0
  z: 0.0" -r 10

⚠️ Before hitting ENTER

  • Confirm the remote is in PC-mode (SWB middle).
  • Make sure the red e-stop is released (SWD down).

Please refer to the accompanying video.
